My BC breast start to feel a little bit sensitive and also got an itchy nipple! I'm using aqueous cream and apply them every 4 hours.

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2011 02:18AM - edited Mar 26, 2011 02:21AM by mightymon Hi Sammolisa, my last Taxol was on March the 8th. I will be joining the April Rad crew on Tue the 5th. I'm so glad that the chemo is over! At the moment I'm just try to enjoy myself. It's so nice to have a break from all the hospital visits!  I'm try not to think about the Rad yet, but I do go and check in March 11 Rad post every now and then.  (((((((((Sammolisa))))))))))

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2010 10:14AM mightymon wrote: Hi Pam,  My port is also very visible. I had mine in on 1st of Nov, the 1st week are a bit sore and uncomfortable. The 2nd week was not too bad at all. I manage to do some yoga, free weight and riding without any pain. Running and swimming will be the next one on my list. Also I had to buy some new bras to go with the port.

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2010 04:27PM mightymon wrote: Hi ladies!! I'm so glad i found this post!!  I had surgery to removed all the lymph nodes on 10 Sept and had 1 drain. Yesterday was my lowest point of this BC journey (so far). I HATE the drain. It's sore, uncomfortable just evil!!!  I'm counting down on the day when it will be gone from my body. My doctor want the drain output over a 24 hours period to be 15ml or less over 2 consecutive days before drain can be removed. I get a bit upset because it had been 10 days and still 40ml. But after I had read all of your posts and some of you had 2 or more drain to deal with. Wow! I'm stop complaining, you all are a trouper!!!!
